info.description:
Endpoints labeled open do not require authentication. The protected endpoints on the other hand, do require
authentication. I'm not sure how long the jwt token should last. I'm thinking we should set the expire on
that token to be super short - like 5 minutes (upto an hour maybe?) to minimize the amount of time an
attacker can use that token. The refresh token will last longer - currently 7 days. If you make a request
to a protected endpoint using a "Refresh" token in your request headers, you will receive a new
authorization token (set-authorization) and refresh token (set-refresh) in the response headers when
you make a request with an expired authorization token. You MUST replace both tokens in your request headers
to stay authenticated. The old refresh token gets replaced on the backend therefore, you need to use the
new refresh token to remain actively logged in.
info.title: FOMO API

200.description: "data" will contain array of balances with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description: Registers a new device for a user so they may receive push notifications.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Get a user's device by the device's ID.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

200.description: "data" will contain updated device info with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"
the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description: Get all the user keys for this user. The api secrets will not be returned in the response data.

200.description: "data" will contain a list of key info with "status": "success"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description: Associate a new exchange api key to a user's account. Secrets will not be returned in response data.

get.description: Gets a user's key by the key ID. The secret will not be returned in the response data.

delete.description: This will remove the api key from the system.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description:
The login endpoint returns an authorization token in the "set-authorization" response header.
You may also receive an optional refresh token if you include 'remember': true in your post request.
Both tokens will be returned in the reponse headers as "set-refresh" and "set-authorization".

parameters.description: Required. Backend code does not check email atm.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Required. Backend code does not have any password requirements atm.
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: Optional. Return refresh token in response
parameters.name: remember

400.description: email and password are not found in request with "status": "fail"

401.description: unauthorized user because of incorrect password with "status": "fail"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

get.description:
If a valid refresh token is found in the request headers, the server
will attempt to remove the refresh token from the database.

200.description: data will be null with status "success"

400.description: you either sent in no refresh token or the refresh token in the header is not valid with status: "fail"

get.description: Currently returns all orders. Eventually going to add params to filter orders.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

post.description: This will create a new order in the system.

get.description:
Creates a new session for an authenticated user. The session data will eventually contain
whatever info you need to begin a new session. At the moment the response data mirrors
login data. This endpoint depends on the user-service. If the user-service
is unreachable, a 410 with a status of "error" will be returned.
get.summary: create a new session for a user (protected)

200.description: data will be non null with status "success"

410.description: the user-service is unreachable with status "error"

post.description:
Registers a new user. Expects email to be unique. Duplicate email will result
in a bad request.

parameters.description: Required. Must be unique! We need to validate these coming in.
parameters.name: email

400.description: message should relay information with regard to bad request with "status": "fail"

410.description: the user-service is not reachable. The user-service is a microservice that runs independantly from the api. When we take it offline you will receive this error.

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

put.description:
You can change the user's first, last, or email. Note we need to implement a secure method of
verifing the user's new email. This has yet to be implemented.

parameters.description: Optional. Note: we need to validate these!
parameters.name: email

200.description: "data" will contain updated user data with "status": "success"

400.description: message in badrequest should be descriptive with "status": "fail"

401.description: unauthorized user because of incorrect url param with "status": "fail"

410.description: the user-service is unreachable with status "error"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

put.description: Allows an authenticated user to change their password. The url param is the user's id.

200.description: the status will be "success" with data null.

400.description: you did something wrong here with status "fail". Hopefully, the message is descriptive enough.

401.description: the user ID in url param does not match with status "fail".

410.description: the user-service is unreachable with status "error"

500.description: the message will state what the internal server error was with "status": "error"

DB.description:
The sql package creates and frees connections automatically; it
also maintains a free pool of idle connections. If the database has
a concept of per-connection state, such state can only be reliably
observed within a transaction. Once DB.Begin is called, the
returned Tx is bound to a single connection. Once Commit or
Rollback is called on the transaction, that transaction's
connection is returned to DB's idle connection pool. The pool size
can be controlled with SetMaxIdleConns.
DB.title:
DB is a database handle representing a pool of zero or more
underlying connections. It's safe for concurrent use by multiple
goroutines.
